jparsec.graph.chartRendering

Class Projection

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.chartRendering.Projection

  • public class Projection
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides support for drawing the sky using different kind of projections. The projections are implemented here without using other (more complete) libraries, since these other libraries are generally too slow.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Projection.PROJECTION
      The set of available projections.

      • Projection

        public Projection(TimeElement time,
          ObserverElement obs,
          EphemerisElement eph,
          SkyRenderElement render,
          double field,
          int x0,
          int y0)
           throws JPARSECException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        render - Render object.
        field - Field of view in radians.
        x0 - X center position in pixels.
        y0 - Y center position in pixels.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        field - Field of view in radians.

        y0 - Y center position in pixels.

        Returns:
        True if it is invalid.

        Throws:

      • getApproximateAngularDistance

        public double getApproximateAngularDistance(LocationElement loc)
        Returns the distance to the current central position of rendering. better than 0.2 deg of precision.
        Parameters:
        loc - The position in the current coordinate system.
        Returns:
        Approximate angular distance.

      • getApproximateAngularDistance

        public double getApproximateAngularDistance(double ra,
                                   double dec)
        Returns the distance to the current central position of rendering. better than 0.2 deg of precision.
        Parameters:
        ra - RA or longitude;
        dec - DEC or latitude.
        Returns:
        Approximate angular distance.

      • setField

        public void setField(double field)
        Changes the field of view.
        Parameters:
        field - New field of view in radians.

      • getField

        public double getField()
        Returns the field of view.
        Returns:
        Field of view in radians.

      • getHorizonElevation

        public double getHorizonElevation()
        Returns the elevation of the horizon.
        Returns:
        Elevation of the horizon in radians.

      • setHorizonElevation

        public void setHorizonElevation(double val)
        Sets the elevation of the horizon.
        Parameters:
        val - Elevation of the horizon in radians. Positive value. In case of a negative input (or 5 degrees in radians, which is a special value used internally) it will be recomputed for the currently selected location.

      • project

        public float[] project(LocationElement loc,
              int size,
              boolean check_limits)
                throws JPARSECException
        Obtains position of an object using the current sky projection and coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        loc - Location object with the position in equatorial coordinates.
        size - Angular radius of rendered object in pixels.
        check_limits - True to check for object limits in the rendered window (in a soft way).
        Returns:
        Array with (x, y) position in the screen.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • projectEarthShadow

        public float[] projectEarthShadow(LocationElement loc,
                         int size,
                         boolean check_limits)
                           throws JPARSECException
        Obtains position of an object using the current sky projection and coordinate system. Special for Earth's shadow cone.
        Parameters:
        loc - Location object with the position in equatorial coordinates.
        size - Angular radius of rendered object in pixels.
        check_limits - True to check for object limits in the rendered window (in a soft way).
        Returns:
        Array with (x, y) position in the screen.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • disableCorrectionOfLocalHorizon

        public void disableCorrectionOfLocalHorizon()
        Disables correction of local horizon.

      • enableCorrectionOfLocalHorizon

        public void enableCorrectionOfLocalHorizon()
        Resets the value of the correction of local horizon.

      • getApparentLocationInSelectedCoordinateSystem

        public LocationElement getApparentLocationInSelectedCoordinateSystem(LocationElement locIn,
                                                            boolean checkHorizon,
                                                            boolean fast,
                                                            float angRadius)
                                                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns apparent position of the input equatorial position correcting for local horizon and coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        locIn - Input coordinates in equatorial system.
        checkHorizon - True to return null if the object is below the horizon and only the sky above horizon should be drawn.
        fast - True for an approximate but faster calculation.
        angRadius - Angular radius of the object in radians.
        Returns:
        Output position, or null if the object will not be visible and to check horizon is enabled.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getApparentLocationInSelectedCoordinateSystem

        public LocationElement getApparentLocationInSelectedCoordinateSystem(LocationElement locIn,
                                                            boolean checkHorizon,
                                                            boolean fast,
                                                            CoordinateSystem.COORDINATE_SYSTEM coordinateSystem,
                                                            float angRadius)
                                                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns apparent position of the input equatorial position correcting for local horizon and coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        locIn - Input coordinates in equatorial system.
        checkHorizon - True to return null if the object is below the horizon and only the sky above horizon should be drawn.
        fast - True for an approximate but faster calculation.
        coordinateSystem - The coordinate system for the output position.
        angRadius - Angular radius of the object in radians.
        Returns:
        Output position, or null if the object will not be visible and to check horizon is enabled.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • projectPosition

        public float[] projectPosition(LocationElement loc,
                      float size,
                      boolean check_limits)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Obtains position of an object using the current sky projection and coordinate system, without transforming them to equatorial.
        Parameters:
        loc - Location object with the position in a given coordinate system.
        size - Angular radius of rendered object in pixels.
        check_limits - True to check for object limits in the rendered window (in a soft way).
        Returns:
        Array with (x, y) position in the screen.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • projectPosition

        public float[] projectPosition(float[] loc,
                      float size,
                      boolean check_limits)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Obtains position of an object using the current sky projection and coordinate system, without transforming them to equatorial.
        Parameters:
        loc - Location object with the position in a given coordinate system.
        size - Angular radius of rendered object in pixels.
        check_limits - True to check for object limits in the rendered window (in a soft way).
        Returns:
        Array with (x, y) position in the screen.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • projectPosition

        public float[] projectPosition(LocationElement loc,
                      int size,
                      boolean check_limits,
                      int factor)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Obtains position of an object using the current sky projection and coordinate system, without transforming them to equatorial.
        Parameters:
        loc - Location object with the position in a given coordinate system.
        size - Angular radius of rendered object in pixels.
        check_limits - True to check for object limits in the rendered window (in a soft way).
        factor - Number of screen widths to consider a position as invalid.
        Returns:
        Array with (x, y) position in the screen.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • isCylindricalForced

        public boolean isCylindricalForced()
        Returns true if cylindrical equidistant projection is forced to ensure that sky is correctly drawn at the scales of planets.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • cylindricalEquidistant

        public float[] cylindricalEquidistant(LocationElement loc)
        Obtains position of an object using cylindrical equidistant projection. Used if field of view is lower than 30 deg.
        Parameters:
        loc - Location object with the position, in equatorial, horizontal, galactic, or ecliptic coordinates.
        Returns:
        Array with (x, y) position in the screen.

      • invertCylindricEquidistant

        public LocationElement invertCylindricEquidistant(float pox,
                                         float poy)
        Obtains position of an object by inverting the cylindric equidistant sky projection.
        Parameters:
        pox - X position.
        poy - Y position.
        Returns:
        Coordinates in the sky, or null if the position cannot be calculated.

      • stereographic

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Array with (x, y) position in the screen.

      • toEquatorialPosition

        public LocationElement toEquatorialPosition(LocationElement loc,
                                   boolean fast)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns equatorial position.
        Parameters:
        loc - Input position in current coordinate system.
        fast - True for an approximate but faster calculation.
        Returns:
        Equatorial position.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getNorthAngleAt

        public double getNorthAngleAt(LocationElement loc00,
                     boolean isEquatorial,
                     boolean passToEarth)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Gets the north angle at a specific equatorial position.
        Parameters:
        loc00 - Position. If null the angle will be calculated for the current central position of the rendering.
        isEquatorial - True if the input position is in equatorial coordinates, false if it is (possibly) in other coordinate system.
        passToEarth - True to get north angle considering that the input position should be converted to that from Earth, in case the observer is located in another planet.
        Returns:
        The angle towards north in radians.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getCenitAngleAt

        public double getCenitAngleAt(LocationElement loc00,
                     boolean isEquatorial)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Gets the north angle at a specific equatorial position.
        Parameters:
        loc00 - Position. If null the angle will be calculated for the current central position of the rendering.
        isEquatorial - True if the input position is in equatorial coordinates, false if it is (possibly) in other coordinate system.
        Returns:
        The angle towards zenith in radians.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • setPoleAngle

        public void setPoleAngle(double ang)
        Sets a new direction for the pole in the current projection. This overrides the initial value in the SkyRenderElement object.
        Parameters:
        ang - The new angle, in radians.

      • invertStereographic

        public LocationElement invertStereographic(float pox,
                                  float poy)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Obtains position of an object by inverting the stereographic sky projection.
        Parameters:
        pox - X position.
        poy - Y position.
        Returns:
        Coordinates in the sky, or null if the position cannot be calculated.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getPositionFromBody

        public LocationElement getPositionFromBody(LocationElement loc,
                                  boolean fast)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Transforms the equatorial position of a body as seen from Earth to the location as seen from a given body, rotating to account for the direction of its north pole of rotation.
        Parameters:
        loc - Equatorial position from Earth.
        fast - True for approximate but fast computation.
        Returns:
        The new location.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getPositionFromEarth

        public LocationElement getPositionFromEarth(LocationElement loc,
                                   boolean fast)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Transforms the equatorial position of a body as seen from another body to the location as seen from Earth, de-rotating to account for the direction of the north pole of rotation of the mother (original) body. This method uses IAU resolutions, which provides an acceptable accuracy.
        Parameters:
        loc - Equatorial position from a given body.
        fast - True for approximate but fast computation.
        Returns:
        The new location from Earth.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused.
